table.name: mem
table.column: мясо с туловища животного, животное, животное(лёгкое оскорбление)
carne da parte do meio dos animais
This may have bones. In some regional dialects, {ghab:n:nolink} is not applied to meat lacking bones, but rather, {ghab tun:n} is used instead.
Данное "мясо" может иметь кости. В некоторых региональных диалектах, слово {ghab:n:nolink} не применяется к мясу, у которого отсутствуют кости. Для этого предпочтительней использовать {ghab tun:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: meat from midsection of animal, no bones
Fleisch vom Rumpf des Tieres, ohne Knochen
گوشت از متوسط ​​ماده حیوانی، بدون استخوان [AUTOTRANSLATED]
kött från mittdelen av djur, utan ben
動物中段的肉、沒有骨頭 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
carne da parte do meio dos animais, sem ossos
In the standard dialect, this would be expressed using the phrase {Hom Hutlhbogh ghab@@Hom:n:1, Hutlh:v, -bogh:v, ghab:n}.
В стандартном диалекте, это может быть выражено, используя фразу {Hom Hutlhbogh ghab@@Hom:n:1, Hutlh:v, -bogh:v, ghab:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: The general word for kill is {HoH:v}. {ghab:v:nolink} means "kill" as a result of hunting (thus the hunt was a successful one), or when the killing is the result of a planned-out process.[1]
In hunting jargon, to "bag" an animal is to successfully hunt it.

table.name: mem
table.column: lurk, lie in wait, lie low
خجالت بکش، صبر کن، دروغ کم [AUTOTRANSLATED]
lura, ligga i väntan, ligga lågt [AUTOTRANSLATED]
espreitar, ficar à espreita, ficar abaixado
This means that the subject is hidden but posing a threat, such as being ready to ambush.[1]
The first half of the example sentence was a lip-match for the beginning of {'ej jIHvo' nIHDI' jIbup:sen@@'ej:conj, jIH:n:1h, -vo':n, nIH:v, -DI':v, jI-:v, bup:v}.
▶ {ghach jIvvo' naH. DaH pIghvamDaq So''eghtaH.@@ghach:v, jIvvo':n, naH:v, DaH:adv, pIgh:n, -vam:n, -Daq:n, So':v, -'egh:v, -taH:v} "There is a criminal hiding in these ruins."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the sound made when gargling.

table.name: mem
mem
table.column: This literally means "he/she wants the wind to respect him/her".
Dies bedeutet wörtlich "er / sie möchte, dass der Wind ihn / sie respektiert". [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این به معنای واقعی کلمه به معنای "او / او می خواهد باد به او احترام بگذارد". [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta betyder bokstavligen "han / hon vill att vinden ska respektera honom / henne". [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Дословно это означает "он/она хочет, чтобы ветер уважал её"
這字面意思是“他/她希望風尊重他/她”。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Isso significa literalmente "ele / ela quer que o vento o respeite". [AUTOTRANSLATED]
▶ {muvuvpu' SuS vIneH.:sen:nolink} "I acted like a fool." ▶ {bImaw''a'? Duvuv SuS DaneH'a'?:sen:nolink} "What's with you? Are you an idiot?"
▶ {muvuvpu' SuS vIneH.:sen:nolink} "Я действовал, как дурак." ▶ {bImaw''a'? Duvuv SuS DaneH'a'?:sen:nolink} "Что с тобой такое? Ты идиот?"

table.name: mem
table.column: This word can be used both to indicate ownership over an object (see {yer ghajwI' chaw':n}) and possession of a more abstract nature (see {pIch:n} and {quv:n}).
Это слово может быть использовано как для обозначения владения над объектом (see {yer ghajwI' chaw':n}) как и для владения более абстрактными вещами (see {pIch:n} and {quv:n}).

▶ {pIch vIghajbe'.:sen} "It's not my fault."[1] ▶ {Hov ghajbe'bogh ram rur pegh ghajbe'bogh jaj.:sen}[2] ▶ {quv lughaj 'archer HoD beqDaj je.:sen}[3] ▶ {Duj ghajchugh pagh, beylI'vo' 'oH Daje' net chaw'.:sen:nolink} "If (the ship is) unowned, you may buy it from the Bank."[4]

▶ {pIch vIghajbe'.:sen} "Это не моя вина."[1] ▶ {Hov ghajbe'bogh ram rur pegh ghajbe'bogh jaj.:sen}[2] ▶ {quv lughaj 'archer HoD beqDaj je.:sen}[3] ▶ {Duj ghajchugh pagh, beylI'vo' 'oH Daje' net chaw'.:sen:nolink} "Если (корабль) безхозный, вы можете выкупить его у банка."[4]

table.name: mem
table.column: Note that Klingon notions of legal ownership may not be the same as Federation ones.
Beachten Sie, dass klingonische Vorstellungen von rechtlichem Eigentum möglicherweise nicht mit denen der Föderation identisch sind. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
توجه داشته باشید که مفاهیم مالکیت قانونی کلینگون ممکن است یکسان با فدراسیون نباشد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Observera att Klingon-uppfattningar om lagligt ägande kanske inte är desamma som föreningarna. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Обратите внимание, что клингонские представления о законной собственности могут не совпадать с понятиями Федерации. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
請注意，法定所有權的克林崗概念可能與聯邦的概念不同。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Observe que as noções klingon de propriedade legal podem não ser as mesmas da Federação. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Throughout {Klingon Monopoly:src}, {ghaj:v} is translated as "own", but this may be because possession is the closest concept in Klingon culture to ownership.

table.name: mem
table.column: Jealousy is also expressed by the idiom {SuD veqlargh mInDu'.:sen}
The word {ghal:v:nolink} was mistakenly used as a noun meaning "envoy" in the Dramatis Personae on {paq'batlh p.40-41:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the animal version of {ghIv:n}.
There is a slang word "gam" in English which means "leg".

table.name: mem
table.column: حیرت انگیز، بسیار فعال، پر جنب و جوش [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: ser pacífico, estar relaxado, ser calmo

table.name: mem
table.column: glance at, take a quick look at
titta på, ta en snabb titt på [AUTOTRANSLATED]
dê uma olhada, dê uma olhada rápida em
To "take a gander" is to take a quick look at something.

table.name: mem
table.column: This denotes the underlying support for an idea, argument, or process, which depending on the context might also be {meq:n} or {qolqoS:n}.

This was defined as "basis/foundation". The word "conceptual" was added to distinguish this from {qappam:n}.
This is the "cornerstone" ({qor:sen:nolink}-{nagh:n}) of something.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to something one copies or refers to in making things.
Dies bezieht sich auf etwas, das man kopiert oder bei der Herstellung von Dingen. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این به چیزی است که یکی در ساخت چیزها کپی می کند یا به آن اشاره دارد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta hänvisar till något man kopierar eller hänvisar till när man gör saker. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это относится к чему-то, что один копирует или относится к созданию вещей [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這指的是一個人復製或指的是製造事物。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Isso se refere a algo que se copia ou se refere ao fazer coisas. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: Reversed, this is {qI':sen:nolink} (sounds like "key") + {nagh:n} ("stone"), a reference to the Keystone Cops.

table.name: mem
table.column: end prematurely (an event, voyage, battle, play, opera, story, song, etc.)
vorzeitig beenden (ein Ereignis, Reise, Schlacht, Schauspiel, Oper, Geschichte, Lied, usw.)
پایان دادن به زود هنگام (یک رویداد، سفر، نبرد، بازی، اپرا، داستان، آهنگ، و غیره) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
avsluta i förtid (en händelse, t.ex. resa, strid, sång)
преждевременный конец (событие, путешествие, битва, игра, опера, история, песня и т. д.) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
過早結束（事件，航程、戰鬥、戲劇、歌劇、故事、歌曲等） [AUTOTRANSLATED]
terminar prematuramente (um evento, viagem, batalha, peça, ópera, história, música etc.)

The subject of this verb is the person causing an event to prematurely end. The object is the event that is ended. If the ending of the event was not premature, use {van:v:2} instead. To describe the ending of a period of time, use {Dor:v:2} instead.
Quite often, the hitting of a "gong" brings an event to a premature end.
▶ {DIvI' rojmab qep ghanglu' 'e' nIDlu', 'ach taH qep.:sen:nolink} "Despite efforts to halt them, peace talks with Federation continue."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This may also be used for things that resemble jaws, in which case the plural remains {ghapqa'Du':n@@ghapqa':n, -Du':n}.[1]
Orca ({ghap:conj}, {-qa':v:suff}) was the name of the boat in the movie "Jaws".

table.name: mem
table.column: The equator is at "lat"itude zero ({pagh:n:2}). Also, the transit token for the Capital Transit Company has a circular shape with the word "Capital" written across the equator.

table.name: mem
table.column: способствовать, делать вклад в какое-то дело
This word is also used for "support" in the monetary sense.[2]
Это слово также используется для обозначения денежной поддержки
▶ {potlhqu' Huch Daghaqbogh:sen:nolink} "money that you contribute is very important"[3]
▶ {potlhqu' Huch Daghaqbogh:sen:nolink} "деньги, что вы вложили, очень важны"[3]
[1] {TKD:src}, [2] {KLI mailing list 2010.07.26:src}, [3] {Pop Culture Hero Coalition announcement:src} ({KLI mailing list 2016.11.30:src})

table.name: mem
table.column: This is what Klingons would call the Terran vegetable.
Dies ist, was Klingonen das terranische Gemüse nennen würden. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این چیزی است که کلینگون ها آن را سبزیجات Terran می نامند. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Det här är vad Klingons skulle kalla Terran-grönsaken. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это то, что Клингоны называют земным овощем.
這就是克林崗人所說的人族蔬菜。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Isso é o que os klingons chamariam de vegetal terráqueo. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: The object of this verb is the hole that's produced (such as a trench or a ditch).
Das Objekt dieses Verbs ist das Loch, das erzeugt wird (wie ein Graben oder ein Graben). [AUTOTRANSLATED]
هدف این فعل سوراخ تولید شده است (مانند سنگر یا خندق). [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Syftet med detta verb är hålet som produceras (t.ex. en dike eller en dike). [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Объектом этого глагола является отверстие, которое производится (например, траншея или канава). [AUTOTRANSLATED]
該動詞的對像是產生的孔（例如溝槽或溝渠）。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
O objeto desse verbo é o buraco produzido (como uma vala ou uma vala). [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: The name of a Klingon Chancellor. He is portrayed by the actor {rabe'rIt 'o'raylIy:n:name}.
Имя Клингонского канцлера. Он сыгран актёром {rabe'rIt 'o'raylIy:n:name}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This word is avoided in {voSpegh Sep:n}, where {'IghvaH chej chatlh:n} is used instead.

table.name: mem
table.column: insecure one, one full of self-doubt
ناامن یکی، پر از شک خود [AUTOTRANSLATED]
osäker person, någon uppfylld av självtvivel, självtvivlare
不安全的人、一個充滿自我懷疑的人 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
pessoa insegura, pessoa cheia de dúvidas
This is a dialectical word used in {voSpegh Sep:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: spraya, spruta, bombardera, fälla, regna ner
распылять, разбрызгивать, бомбардировать, закидывать, заливать чем-то

An English definition has never been given for this word. Its meaning is inferred from the examples of its usage.
This is a possible verb to use with {watrIn:n}.[3]
▶ {bIQ ghaywI' pa':n} ▶ {jorwI'mey ghaymo' qarDaSnganpu', Hegh SuvwI'pu'lI' law' 'ej rIQ SuvwI'pu'lI' law'.:sen:nolink} "Suffer major losses after Cardassian bombing campaign."[2]
▶ {bIQ ghaywI' pa':n} ▶ {jorwI'mey ghaymo' qarDaSnganpu', Hegh SuvwI'pu'lI' law' 'ej rIQ SuvwI'pu'lI' law'.:sen:nolink} "Страдают от крупных потерь после Кардассианской бомбардировки."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: Ругательство общего характера(Прямого перевода не имеет)
[1] {Radio Times Star Trek 30th Anniversary Special Issue:src}

table.name: mem
table.column: In English, "got your goat" is a slang expression referring to irritating someone.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a condiment which is often used to bring out the flavor in {qagh:n} or {raHta':n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: [1] {DSC - Si Vis Pacem, Para Bellum:src}, [2] {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2019:src}

table.name: mem
table.column: {gheb rIl:sen:nolink} is a reference to the horn of Gabriel.

table.name: mem
table.column: This verb is used to ask a question, whereas {tlhob:v} is used for making a request.[2]
It's implied that {ghel:v:nolink} works in a similar manner to {tlhob:v:nolink}, but this isn't explicitly stated.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column:
This refers to a reasonably large group of instrumentalists. The verb used for conducting an orchestra is {ra':v:2}.
A more general term for a group (of any size) playing music is {QoQ ghom:n}.

Dies wird für eine sehr große Gruppe von Musikern verwendet. Das Verb zur ein Orchester dirigieren ist {ra':v:2}.
Ein allgemeiner Begriff für jede Musik spielende Gruppe (egal welcher Größe) ist {QoQ ghom:n}.
Carnegie Hall is a place where many famous orchestras come to play.

table.name: mem
table.column: This verb expresses the idea of bringing thoughts together into a reasonably coherent form so that they can be expressed to someone else. It differs from {qon:v} in that {gher:v:nolink} suggests that information is merely being passed along.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: results, outcome, effect, repercussions, consequence, ramification
نتایج، نتیجه، اثر، پیامدها، نتیجه، صاف کردن [AUTOTRANSLATED]
resultat, resultat, effekt, återverkningar, konsekvens, förgrening [AUTOTRANSLATED]
результаты, исход, эффект, последствия, последствия, разветвление [AUTOTRANSLATED]
結果、結果、影響、反響、結果、分枝 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

The words in the English definition could be interpreted as singular or plural, depending on the context. If it's important to indicate plurality in the Klingon, add {-mey:n:suff}. If it's important to indicate singularity, use {wa':n:num} with {neH:adv} (or something along those lines).[2]
"Results" in the sense of "score, tally" is {mIvwa'mey:n@@mIvwa':n, -mey:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: assume duties of, take on responsibilities of
وظایف خود را انجام دهید، مسئولیت های خود را بر عهده بگیرید [AUTOTRANSLATED]
anta plikter ifrån, ta på sig ansvar ifrån
взять на себя обязанности, взять на себя ответственность [AUTOTRANSLATED]

▶ {DaH yaS wa'DIch vIgheS@@DaH:adv, yaS:n, wa'DIch:n, vI-:v, gheS:v} "I now take my place as first officer", or literally, "Now I assume the responsibilities of first officer"[1, p.182] ▶ {juDev 'ej Dujvam ra'wI' DagheS 'e' vItlhob:sen@@ju-:v, Dev:v, 'ej:conj, Duj:n:1, ra'wI':n, Da-:v, gheS:v, 'e':n, vI-:v, tlhob:v} "I ask you to lead us as commander of this ship", or literally, "I request that you lead us and that you assume the duties of commander of this ship"[1, p.184]

table.name: mem
table.column: No deception is implied by the use of this word. It simply indicates role-playing.
Die Verwendung dieses Wortes impliziert keine Täuschung. Es zeigt einfach Rollenspiele an. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
هیچ فریبکاری با استفاده از این کلمه دلالت ندارد. این فقط نقش بازیگری را نشان می دهد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Inget bedrägeri antyds av användningen av detta ord. Det indikerar helt enkelt rollspel. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Использование этого слова не подразумевает никакого обмана. Это просто указывает на ролевую игру. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
使用該詞並不意味著任何欺騙。它只是表示角色扮演。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Nenhum engano é implícito pelo uso desta palavra. Simplesmente indica role-playing. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: någon som låtsas, person som låtsas
No deception is implied by the use of this word. It simply indicates role-playing.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the name of a warrior who singlehandedly defeated an invading force.
Dies ist der Name eines Kriegers, der eine Invasionsmacht im Alleingang besiegt hat. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این نام یک جنگجو است که به طور یکجانبه یک نیروی متجاوز را شکست. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta är namnet på en krigare som på egen hand besegrade en invaderande styrka. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это имя воина, который в одиночку победил вторжение. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這是單槍匹馬擊敗入侵力量的戰士的名字。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Este é o nome de um guerreiro que derrotou sozinho uma força invasora. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This word appears only in the body of {KGT:src} and not in the glossary.

table.name: mem
table.column: This region contains the city of {ruq'e'vet:n}. It is named after {ghevchoq:n:name}.
This word appears only in the body of {KGT:src} and not in the glossary.

table.name: mem
table.column: There is an idiom, {jeD; ghevI' rur@@jeD:v, ghevI':n, rur:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: In the "Radio Times Star Trek 30th Anniversary Special Issue", cricket (the sport) is translated as {ghew:n:nolink}. Specifically, "Cricket, please." was translated as {DaH ghew yIQuj.:sen:nolink}[3]
[1] {TKDA:src}, [2] {PK:src}, [3] {Radio Times Star Trek 30th Anniversary Special Issue:src}

table.name: mem
table.column: According to the novelisation of {Star Trek VI:src}, this is an idiom which is smugglers' slang for wishing someone good luck in avoiding border officials.

table.name: mem
table.column: be transformed, transmuted, metamorphosed, totally altered
umgewandelt, transmutiert, metamorphosiert, völlig verändert sein
تبدیل، تبدیل، دگرگون شده، کاملا تغییر یافته است [AUTOTRANSLATED]
быть трансформированным, трансмутированным, метаморфизированным, полностью измененным [AUTOTRANSLATED]
被改造、變形、變形、完全改變 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
ser transformado, transmutado, metamorfoseado, totalmente alterado
Gregor Samsa is the main character of the Franz Kafka novella "The Metamorphosis".

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a short way to refer to an energy field of some sort that causes terraforming to happen. A longer way to refer to this concept would be {ghe'moHbogh HoSchem:n@@ghe':v, -moH:v, -bogh:v, HoSchem:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: An example of Klingon opera is "Aktuh and Melota" (see {'aqtu':n:name} and {mellota':n:name}).

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a {ghe'naQ:n} following the traditional form preferred by purists.

table.name: mem
table.column: Gre'thor, netherworld (where spirits of dishonored go)
Gre'thor, Unterwelt (wohin die Seelen der Entehrten gehen)
Gre'thor، netherworld (جایی که ارواح فریب خورده اند) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Гретор, преисподняя (место, куда уходят души обесчещенных)
Gre'thor、地獄世界（被羞辱的精神去哪裡） [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Gre'thor, submundo (para onde vão os espíritos desonrados)
It is written {ghe''or:n:place,nolink} in {TKDA:src} and pronounced that way in {PK:src}, but is consistently written {ghe'tor:n:place,nolink} in later sources.

table.name: mem
table.column: هنگامی که ارواح فرار از Gre'thor [AUTOTRANSLATED]
quando os espíritos escapam de Gre'thor
This is similar to the Terran expression "when pigs fly".
Dies ähnelt dem terranischen Ausdruck "wenn Schweine fliegen". [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این شبیه به بیان Terran است "وقتی خوک ها پرواز می کنند". [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это похоже на земное выражение "когда свиньи полетят" или "когда рак на горе свистнет"
這類似於人形表達“豬飛時”。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Isso é semelhante à expressão terráquea "quando os porcos voam". [AUTOTRANSLATED]
▶ {jIjegh ghe'torvo' narghDI' qa'pu'.:sen:nolink} "I will surrender when spirits escape from Gre'thor." (That is, "I will never surrender.")
▶ {jIjegh ghe'torvo' narghDI' qa'pu'.:sen:nolink} "Я сдамся, когда души сбегут из Гретора!" (т.е, "Я никогда не сдамся.")

table.name: mem
table.column: You belong in a black hole in the netherworld!
Du gehörst in ein schwarzes Loch in der Unterwelt!
شما متعلق به یک سیاهچاله در خاورمیانه هستید! [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Du hör hemma i ett svart hål i Nederländerna! [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Вы принадлежите к черной дыре в преисподней! [AUTOTRANSLATED]
你屬於地獄世界的黑洞！ [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Você pertence a um buraco negro no submundo!

table.name: mem
table.column:
There is an idiom, {boch; ghIch rur@@boch:v, ghIch:n, rur:v}.[2, p.133]
There is also a regional word {ley':n} which means "nose".
Есть идиома, {boch; ghIch rur@@boch:v, ghIch:n, rur:v}.[2, стр.133] Есть слово {ley':n}, которое означает рыло.

table.name: mem
table.column: If you shine my nose, I will give you your nose.
Wenn du meine Nase polierst gebe ich dir deine Nase.
اگر بینی خود را درخشیدید، من بینی خود را به شما خواهم داد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Om du skiner min näsa, kommer jag att ge dig näsan. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Если ты светишь мне носом, я отдам тебе нос. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
如果你擦亮我的鼻子，我會給你你的鼻子。
Se você polir meu nariz, eu lhe darei seu nariz.
This idiom is used to mean "Do not try to mislead me if you value your life."
Diese Redewendung bedeutet: "Versuchen Sie nicht, mich in die Irre zu führen, wenn Sie Ihr Leben schätzen." [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این اصطلاح به معنای "این است که اگر ارزش زندگی خود را دارید گمراه نکنید." [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Det här uttrycket används för att betyda "Försök inte vilseleda mig om du värdesätter ditt liv." [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Эта идиома используется для обозначения: «Не пытайтесь ввести меня в заблуждение, если вы цените свою жизнь». [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這個習慣用語的意思是“如果珍惜生命，請不要誤導我”。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Esse idioma é usado para significar "Não tente me enganar se você valoriza sua vida". [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: vara slarvig, vara sjabbig, vara rörig, vara kladdig

table.name: mem
table.column: In the {ruq'e'vet:n} dialect, this word is used in addition to {yepHa':v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: May your enemies run with fear.
Mögen deine Feinde mit Schrecken davonrennen
ممکن است دشمنان شما با ترس کار کنند [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Må dina fiender springa av rädsla. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Пусть твои враги бегут в ужасе
願你的敵人恐懼地奔跑。
Que seus inimigos corram com medo.
This sentence is archaic. It is ungrammatical in modern standard Klingon.
Dieser Satz ist archaisch. Es ist ungrammatisch im modernen klingonischen Standard. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این جمله باستانی است. در استاندارد مدرن کلینگون غیرقابل توصیف است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Denna mening är arkaisk. Det är ungrammatiskt i modern standard Klingon. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這句話是過時的。在現代標準克林崗語中，它是不合語法的。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Esta frase é arcaica. Não é gramatical no padrão moderno Klingon. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: be the mean, be the average (arithmetic mean, used in math)
میانگین باشد ، میانگین باشد (میانگین حسابی ، در ریاضی استفاده می شود) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
vara medelvärdet, vara medelvärdet (aritmetiskt medelvärde, används i matematik) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
быть средним, быть средним (среднее арифметическое, используется в математике) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
是平均值，是平均值（算術平均值，在數學中使用） [AUTOTRANSLATED]
ser a média aritmética (usada em matemática)
"Mean Girls" is the name of a film.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a small, irritating insect with no sting, which makes a slight buzzing sound. There is a Klingon idiom, {ram; ghIlab ghew rur@@ram:v, ghIlab ghew:n, rur:v}.
▶ {bIQongtaHvIS nItlhejchugh targhmey bIvemDI' nItlhej ghIlab ghewmey.:sen} ▶ {ghIlab ghewmey tIbuSQo'.:sen}

table.name: mem
table.column: Pay no heed to glob flies.
هیچ توجهی به مگس های کوه نکنید. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Не обращайте внимания на шариковых мух
Não preste atenção às moscas glob.

table.name: mem
table.column: 「格拉斯諾斯」、公開性（古老的政治運動）

table.name: mem
table.column: This verb can be used with {turmIq:n}, {qeQ:n}, and {taQbang:n:2}.[2] Klingons don't have euphemisms for going to the bathroom, and would just say {taQbang ghIm:sen:nolink} and so on. The slang expression {qIvon belmoH:sen} is used from time to time, mostly by or to children.[3]
▶ {DaH jImej. turmIq vIghImnIS.:sen@@DaH:adv, jI-:v, mej:v, turmIq:n, vI-:v, ghIm:v, -nIS:v}[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a device which dissipates heat.
Dies bezieht sich auf ein Gerät, das Wärme abführt. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این مربوط به دستگاهی است که گرما را از بین می برد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta avser en anordning som avleder värme. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это относится к устройству, которое рассеивает тепло. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這是指散發熱量的設備。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Refere-se a um dispositivo que dissipa calor. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

Some people believed early on that this was a mistake for {tlhuchwI':n:nolink} (see {tlhuch:v}). However, {tuj ghImwI':n} actually makes sense for a mechanism that dissipates heat, and subsequently revealed information on {ghIm:v} shows that it is correct.

table.name: mem
table.column: 修道院、宗教社群建築物
This refers to a building or group of buildings, including any accompanying grounds such as gardens. It does not refer to the group of people who live, work, or study there.[2]
Plymouth Gin is produced by The Black Friars Distillery, formerly a Dominican monastery in Plymouth, England.

table.name: mem
table.column: {lojmItjaj:n:nolink} tends to be used on formal occasions, while both it and {ghInjaj:n:nolink} are used, seemingly indiscriminately, otherwise.
This refers to a line in "Being for the Benefit of Mr. Kite!" by The Beatles, which partly goes "on Saturday at Bishopsgate".

table.name: mem
table.column: The object of this verb is the person charged and subject to trial (or actually tried) by a military tribunal. The subject is whoever brought the indictment.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: därefter, och sedan, efter det, efteråt
Note that "then" in the sense of "at that time" is {ngugh:adv}.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: In Semitic languages, the triconsonantal root "q-t-l" is related to killing.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is written or represented using symbols.
Dies wird mit Symbolen geschrieben oder dargestellt. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این با استفاده از نمادها نوشته یا نشان داده شده است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta skrivs eller representeras med symboler. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это написано или представлено с использованием символов. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這是用符號書寫或表示的。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Isso é escrito ou representado usando símbolos. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: stiga nedför, fara ned, komma ned, slutta nedåt
This word is not used for sort order.[3]
When descending, you need to drop your landing "gear".

table.name: mem
table.column: This might be used to describe a good bowl of {qagh:n}.
Damit könnte man gut einen Teller voller {qagh:n} beschreiben.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a small animal, apparently not a very vicious one, though one with perhaps a predilection for trying to sound fiercer than it actually is.
Dies ist ein kleines Tier, anscheinend kein sehr bösartiges, obwohl es vielleicht eine Vorliebe dafür hat, heftiger zu klingen, als es tatsächlich ist. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این حیوان کوچک است ، ظاهراً بسیار شرور نیست ، اگرچه ممکن است تمایل به تلاش برای صدابرداری از آنچه در واقع وجود دارد ، داشته باشد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta är ett litet djur, uppenbarligen inte så ond, men ett med kanske en förkärlek för att försöka låta hårdare än det faktiskt är. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это маленькое животное, по всей видимости, не очень злое, хотя и имеющее, возможно, пристрастие к тому, чтобы пытаться казаться более жестоким, чем оно есть на самом деле. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這是一種小動物，顯然不是很兇惡的動物，儘管它可能傾向於聽起來比實際更兇猛。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Este é um animal pequeno, aparentemente não muito cruel, embora talvez tenha uma predileção por tentar parecer mais feroz do que realmente é. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: There is an idiom, {yuDHa'; ghIt rur@@yuDHa':v, ghIt:n:0, rur:v}.[1, p.131]
Someone with writer's cramp might not be able to use his hand to form this.

table.name: mem
table.column: There is an idiom, {yuDHa'; ghIt rur@@yuDHa':v, ghIt:n:0, rur:v}.[1, p.131]

table.name: mem
table.column: If steam is emitted, say {SeS ghItwI':n} instead.

table.name: mem
table.column: The word {ghItlhHom:n:nolink} was used for the "string" variable type in Klingon Blockly.[2]
▶ {ghItlh vIghItlhta'bogh DalaD'a'?:sen:nolink} "Will you read my manuscript?"[1, p.172]

table.name: mem
table.column: حکاکی کردن، برش دادن، علامت گذاری (بر)، نوشتن [AUTOTRANSLATED]
skriva, gravera, rista in, skära in, märka

This verb is used to indicate the making of markings on a surface. It applies not just to writing, but to any kind of marking. To "write" in this sense refers to the physical act of writing, and not to the creation of compositions, for which {qon:v} is used instead.[2; 3] Another verb, {gher:v}, is used for the compilation of lists and the like.[4]

Этот глагол используется, чтобы обозначить нанесение отметок на поверхности. Применяется не просто для "написания", но для любых видов нанесения отметок. Здесь идет речь, чтобы существлять физический процесс письма. Для создания композиций используйте {qon:v}.[2; 3] Другой глагол, {gher:v}, используется для создания списков и т.п[4]

This is defined in {TKD:src} as "write". In {KGT:src}, it was clarified that this meant "engrave, incise, mark (upon)", that is, the phyiscal act of making marks on a surface.
Writing a manuscript takes grit, and may lead to writer's cramp.
▶ {ghItlh vIghItlhta'bogh DalaD'a'?:sen:nolink} "Will you read my manuscript?"[1, p.172]
▶ {ghItlh vIghItlhta'bogh DalaD'a'?:sen:nolink} "Ты прочтешь мою рукопись?"[1, стр.172]

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a line in "Lady Madonna" by The Beatles: "Wednesday morning papers didn't come."

table.name: mem
table.column: stylus, skriftverktyg, penna, person som skriver

This word is used for any writing implement as well as for any person who writes.[1]
In {TNK:src}, {ghItlhwI':n:nolink} is used for "pen" and {ghojmeH ghItlhwI':n:nolink} is used for "pencil".[2]

The instrument/agent confusion is similar to that for the English word "printer", which can refer either to a device or to a person. This word takes the suffix {-mey:n:suff} when it refers to a device and {-pu':n:suff} when it refers to a person.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the person equivalent of {gham:n}.

An early translation of the opera {'u':src} used {QIv:n:nolink} or {qIv:n:nolink} (the capitalisation was inconsistent) in the name of a {moQbara':n} technique which involved legs and arms. Marc Okrand wanted this to make sense, but didn't want to make too drastic a change as the singers had already gotten used to singing the line.

table.name: mem
table.column: There is an idiom, {wov; ghI'boj Sech rur@@wov:v, ghI'boj:n, Sech:n, rur:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: повелительное наклонение:ты(действие)-нам, вы(множественное число)(дейтсвие)-нам, вы(единственное число)-нам

table.name: mem
table.column:
There is an idiom, {vIHtaH gho:sen}.
There are 243 {lawmey:n:nolink} in a {gho:n:nolink}, or 360 {lawrI'mey:n:nolink}. (See {law:n} and {lawrI':n}.)

Есть идиома, {vIHtaH gho:sen}.
Есть 243 {lawmey:n:nolink} в {gho:n:nolink}, или 360 {lawrI'mey:n:nolink}. (See {law:n} and {lawrI':n}.)
▶ {meyrI'Daq 'oHtaH gho'e':sen:nolink} "The circle is in the square."[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers not to a bound notebook, but rather to a ringer binder that one can add papers to and take them out of.
Dies bezieht sich nicht auf ein gebundenes Notizbuch, sondern auf einen Wecker, zu dem man Papiere hinzufügen und herausnehmen kann. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این نه به یک نوت بوک محدود ، بلکه به یک اتصال دهنده رینگر مربوط می شود که می توان کاغذها را به آن اضافه کرد و آنها را بیرون آورد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta hänvisar inte till en bunden anteckningsbok, utan snarare till ett ringband som man kan lägga till papper till och ta ut dem från. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это относится не к переплетенной тетради, а скорее к переплету звонков, в который можно добавлять бумаги и извлекать их. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這不是指裝訂的筆記本，而是指可以在其中添加紙張並將其取出的鈴聲活頁夾。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Isso não se refere a um caderno encadernado, mas a um fichário de campainha ao qual se pode adicionar papéis e tirá-los. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This word refers to the geometric figure.
Dieses Wort bezieht sich auf die geometrische Figur. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این کلمه به شکل هندسی اشاره دارد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta ord hänvisar till den geometriska figuren. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это слово относится к геометрической фигуре. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這個詞指的是幾何圖形。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Esta palavra se refere à figura geométrica. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This word refers to the geometric figure.
Dieses Wort bezieht sich auf die geometrische Figur. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این کلمه به شکل هندسی اشاره دارد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta ord hänvisar till den geometriska figuren. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это слово относится к геометрической фигуре. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這個詞指的是幾何圖形。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Esta palavra se refere à figura geométrica. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: It is probably significant that this word is homophonous with the verb for doing battle or waging war ({ghob:v}).[3]
Вероятно, что это обозначение слова, что является омофоном для глагола для осуществления битвы или ведения войны

table.name: mem
table.column: fight, battle, do battle, wage war
جنگیدن، نبرد، نبرد، جنگ در راه است [AUTOTRANSLATED]
сражаться, бороться, вести битву, вести войну

This verb refers to a concrete fight. For the concept of making war, see {Qoj:v}.
It is probably significant that this word is homophonous with the word for ethics or virtue ({ghob:n}).[2]
In ascending order of ferocity, the verbs used to describe military confrontations are: {Qor:v}, {tlhaS:v}, {vay:v}, {lul:v}, {Hargh:v}.

Этот глагол относится к конкретному бою. Для концепции ведения войны, смотрите {Qoj:v}.
Возможно, что это указание, что данное слово является омофоном для слов этика или добродетель ({ghob:n}).[2]
Чтобы описать свирепость военных противостояний по нарастающей, глаголы расположены в следующем порядке: {Qor:v}, {tlhaS:v}, {vay:v}, {lul:v}, {Hargh:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: لازم نیست از فضیلت لذت ببرید. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Man behöver inte njuta av dygd. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Não é preciso desfrutar da virtude.

table.name: mem
table.column: برادران مبارزه می کنند یکی دیگر [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This is the name of a famous statue showing {qeylIS'e' lIjlaHbe'bogh vay':n:name} and {moratlh:n:name} locked in struggle.

table.name: mem
table.column:
This is the negative answer to a yes/no question (see {-'a':v}). Unlike the English word "no", it is not used as a stand-alone exclamation indicating refusal, disbelief, and so on (for which see {Qo':excl}).
Watch Gowron say this: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/7_rXiSTQmAE}

Это отрицательный ответ на вопрос да/нет (смотрите {-'a':v}). В отличие от слова "нет", данное восклицание не используется, как автономное восклицание, что обозначает отказ, недоверие, и т.д (для обозначения отказа, недоверия и пр, смотрите {Qo':excl}).
Смотрите, как это говорит Гаурон: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/7_rXiSTQmAE}

table.name: mem
table.column: {qeylIS'e' lIjlaHbe'bogh vay':n:name} prophesied he would return there.
{qeylIS'e' lIjlaHbe'bogh vay':n:name} предсказывал, что он вернется сюда.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is used for putting things inside a backpack or a pillow bag, but not stopping up an opening, which would be {qorgh:v}.[2] It is also not used for taxidermy or stuffed animals, for which see {tlhut:v}.
Используется, чтобы описать, как вещи помещаются внутрь рюкзака или мешка, но с незаканчивающимся свободным местом, которое могло бы {qorgh:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: See under {QIch wab Ho'DoS:n} for the names of the Klingon consonants and vowels.

table.name: mem
table.column: Some people have taken to referring to mobile phones using {ghogh HablI' qenglu'bogh:n:nolink}. Context should make it clear if {ghogh HablI':n:nolink} refers to a mobile device.

table.name: mem
table.column: The idiom {jop 'ej way':sen:idiom} expresses a similar idea.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a lesson as in a textbook, and not in the sense of "Let this be a lesson to you!", which is {ghuH:n}. It can also be used to express "tutorial about X", as {X ghojmeH mIw:n:nolink}.

Это относится к уроку, наподобие того, что в тетради или в учебнике. Слово нельзя использовать в выражениях, наподобие "Пусть это будет тебе уроком!". Для подобных слов смотрите {ghuH:n}. Также может быть использовано, чтобы сказать "руководство о ..." {X ghojmeH mIw:n:nolink}.

table.name: mem
table.column: این به معنای واقعی کلمه "چاقو برای یادگیری" است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Despite the fact that the given definition is "boy's knife", the Klingon expression has nothing to do with boys. It just happened to be the case that the protagonist of {KCD:src} was a young man.

table.name: mem
table.column: See {qawmoH:v} for an example of how to use a verb like this one.
Siehe {qawmoH:v} für Beispiele, wie man dieses Verb verwenden kann.
Смотрите {qawmoH:v} как пример того, как использовать глагол, подобный этому.
▶ {ghojwI'pu' chu' ghojmoH jatlhwI'pu' po'qu'.:sen@@ghojwI':n, -pu':n, chu':v:1, ghojmoH:v, jatlh:v, -wI':v, -pu':v, po':v, -qu':v}[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: A teacher held in high esteem, of higher rank than other teachers in the same institution, could be {ghojmoHwI' quv@@ghojmoHwI':n, quv:v} or {ghojmoHwI' Han@@ghojmoHwI':n, Han:v}. Probably the highest standing of all is a {'a'ghen:n:nolink}.[2]

Наиболее почитаемый учитель или учитель рангом выше, чем остальные учителя в том же учреждении - {ghojmoHwI' quv@@ghojmoHwI':n, quv:v} или {ghojmoHwI' Han@@ghojmoHwI':n, Han:v}. Возможно, что наивысшая ступень всего этого - {'a'ghen:n:nolink}.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This seems to be composed of {ghoj:v} and {moq:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {ngIq gholvo' wa'maH QaS yItlhap.:sen:nolink} "Collect 10 forces from every player."[2]
▶ {ngIq gholvo' wa'maH QaS yItlhap.:sen:nolink} "Соберите 10 военнослужащих с каждого игрока."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is used only for groups of people. (The word {mu'ghom:n} is an exception.)[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: This verb can be used with or without an object. If there is an object, then the subject is meeting the object. If there is no object, then the subjects are assembling or meeting each other.[2]
Этот глагол может использоваться как с глаголом, так и без него. Если есть объект, тогда субъект встречает объект. Если нет объекта, тогда субъекты собираются или встречаются друг с другом.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: In {DS9 - Sons and Daughters:src}, Worf dismisses a group of crewmen with {yIghomHa'!:sen:nolink} Since he was addressing multiple people, it should have been {peghomHa'!:sen:nolink}

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the duty roster on a Klingon ship.
Dies bezieht sich auf die Dienstliste auf einem klingonischen Schiff. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این مربوط به لیست وظیفه در کشتی کلینگون است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta avser tulllistan för ett Klingon-fartyg. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это относится к дежурному списку на клингонском корабле. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這是指Klingon船上的值班名冊。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Isto se refere à escala de serviço em uma nave klingon.

table.name: mem
table.column: زرق و برق، زرق و برق [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to abuse or exploitation, but does not refer to physical abuse.[1]
This was defined as "abuse" in {TKD:src}, and expanded to include "exploit" at {qep'a' 26 (2019):src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: The parts of a hand include its {toch:n} "palm", {chap:n} "back (of hand)", and {nItlh:n} "finger(s)" (including the thumb). The hand is attached to the {DeS:n:1} "arm" through the {yeb:n:1} "wrist".

Части руки(о которой здесь упоминается) включают в себя {toch:n} "ладонь", {chap:n} "заднюю сторону (руки)", and {nItlh:n} "палец(цы)" (включая большой палец). Рука прикреплена к {DeS:n:1} "кисти руки" через {yeb:n:1} "запястье".
Something you "grope" with. The reverse of this is {pogh:n}.
▶ {ghopDu'wIjDaq yInmeyraj vIlaj} "I accept your lives into my hands"[2]
▶ {ghopDu'wIjDaq yInmeyraj vIlaj} "Я прнимаю ваши жизни в свои руки"[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is one of the items traditionally displayed on a {nuH bey':n}. It is a gutting device used in balance with a shield.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is defined as "spy" in {TKD:src} and as "spy on" in {KGT:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: تازه می شود، فقط کشته می شود (گوشت) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This is also applied to words (see {mu'mey ghoQ:n}).

table.name: mem
table.column: This line was spoken in Klingon but was not subtitled.
Diese Zeile wurde auf Klingonisch gesprochen, aber nicht mit Untertiteln versehen. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این خط در کلینگون صحبت شد اما زیرنویس نبود. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Denna rad talades i Klingon men undertecknades inte. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Эта строка говорилась на клингонском языке, но не имела субтитров. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
此行在克林崗語中被使用，但沒有字幕。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Esta linha foi falada em klingon, mas não foi legendada. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: When will the water be hot?

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a creature also referred to as a "space whale". This is a loanword from another language.
Dies ist eine Kreatur, die auch als "Weltraumwal" bezeichnet wird. Dies ist ein Lehnwort aus einer anderen Sprache. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این موجودی است که از آن به عنوان "نهنگ فضایی" نیز یاد می شود. این یک وام از زبان دیگری است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta är en varelse som också kallas en "rymdval". Detta är ett lånord från ett annat språk. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это существо также называют «космический кит». Это заимствованное слово из другого языка. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這是一種生物，也稱為“太空鯨魚”。這是另一種語言的外來詞。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Esta é uma criatura também conhecida como "baleia espacial". Esta é uma palavra de empréstimo de outro idioma. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
[1] {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2017:src}, [2] {DSC - Magic to Make the Sanest Man Go Mad:src}

table.name: mem
table.column: Chancellor Gorkon ({ghorqan Qang:n:nolink}) was a character in {Star Trek VI:src}. One of his legendary forebearers was also named "Gorkon", but the name was pronounced {ghorqon:n:name} during his time.

table.name: mem
table.column: The reference in {Hamlet:src} is not to the Chancellor ({ghorqan:n:name}) who sought peace with the Federation, but to one of his legendary ancestors.[2]
В {Hamlet:src} упоминается не ({ghorqan:n:name}), кто стремился заключить мир с Федерацией, а один из его предков

table.name: mem
table.column: approach, go away from, proceed, come, follow (a course)
رویکرد، از بین برود، ادامه دهید، بیا، دنبال (یک دوره) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
fortsätta framåt, nalkas, komma närmare, avlägsna sig ifrån
приближаться, уходить от, приступать, идти, следовать (курсу)
接近、離開、繼續、來、跟隨（一門課程） [AUTOTRANSLATED]
aproximar-se, afastar-se, prosseguir, vir, seguir (um curso)

This can mean either "approach" or "go away from" depending on the presence of nouns with the suffixes {-Daq:n} and {-vo':n}. The way to use {ghoS:v:nolink} and other verbs of movement are described in {HQ 7.4:src}[2]. See {jaH:v} for details.

Это может означать как "приближение" так и "уходить от", в зависимости от присутствия существительных с суффиксами {-Daq:n} и {-vo':n}. Способ использования {ghoS:v:nolink} и других глаголов, описывающих движение, смотрите в {HQ 7.4:src}[2]. Смотрите {jaH:v} для более подробной информации.
▶ {bIghHa'Daq yIghoS:sen:nolink} "Go to jail"[1, p.170] ▶ {He chu' ghoS, DIvI' neHmaH.:sen}
▶ {bIghHa'Daq yIghoS:sen:nolink} "Отправляйся в тюрьму"[1, стр.170] ▶ {He chu' ghoS, DIvI' neHmaH.:sen}

table.name: mem
table.column: When this word is plural, it focuses more on the individuals making up the group. So {ghotpu':n@@ghot:n, -pu':n} would probably be translated as "persons" (rather than "people"), but this is not a strict rule.[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: A single personnel file would presumably be a {ghot ta:n:nolink}.

table.name: mem
table.column: fish, most general word for fish-like creature
ماهی، کلمه کلیدی برای موجودات ماهی مانند [AUTOTRANSLATED]
рыба, самое общее слово для рыбоподобного существа [AUTOTRANSLATED]
魚、魚類生物最常用的詞
peixe, palavra mais geral para criatura parecida com peixe
Every {ghotI':n:nolink} is a {bIQDep:n}, but not every {bIQDep:n:nolink} is a {ghotI':n:nolink}.[3]
This is based on a joke English spelling for "fish".

table.name: mem
table.column: Someone going at sublight speed really needs to "step on" it (see {gho':v}).

table.name: mem
table.column:
This is a kind of skin blemish or inflammation affecting Klingons underdoing puberty.[1; 2]
This word is alien in origin. The reason Klingons use an alien word for this is to put some distance between themselves and something considered embarrassing.[3]
[1] {Star Trek Insurrection:src}, [2] {How to Speak Klingon, p.7:src}, [3] {KLI mailing list 2013.07.29:src}

table.name: mem
table.column: This word refers to an infant, and should not be used in addressing an adult (unless the intention is to insult). Unlike in Federation Standard, calling someone "baby" in Klingon is not a sign of affection.

Dieses Wort bezieht sich auf ein Kind und sollte nicht zur Ansprache eines Erwachsenen verwendet werden (es sei denn, es soll beleidigt werden). Anders als in Federation Standard ist es kein Zeichen von Zuneigung, jemanden auf Klingonisch "Baby" zu nennen. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

این کلمه به یک نوزاد اطلاق می شود و نباید در خطاب به یک فرد بزرگسال استفاده شود (مگر اینکه قصد توهین باشد). برخلاف استاندارد فدراسیون ، نامیدن کسی به عنوان "کودک" در کلینگون نشانه محبت نیست. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

Detta ord hänvisar till ett spädbarn och bör inte användas för att adressera en vuxen (om inte avsikten är att förolämpa). Till skillnad från i Federation Standard är det inte ett tecken på tillgivenhet att kalla någon "baby" i Klingon. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

Это слово относится к младенцу и не должно использоваться при обращении к взрослому (кроме случаев, когда целью является оскорбление). В отличие от Стандартов Федерации, называть кого-то «ребенком» в клингоне не является признаком привязанности. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這個詞指的是嬰兒，請勿用於稱呼成年人（除非意圖侮辱他人）。與聯邦標準不同，在克林崗州稱某人為“嬰兒”並不表示有愛心。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

Esta palavra se refere a uma criança e não deve ser usada para se dirigir a um adulto (a menos que a intenção seja insultar). Ao contrário do Federation Standard, chamar alguém de "bebê" em Klingon não é sinal de afeto. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This is probably the sound a Klingon baby makes. Also, "goo".

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the flower, fruit, or shoot before it develops.
Dies bezieht sich auf die Blume, Frucht oder den Spross, bevor er sich entwickelt. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
این به گل ، میوه یا شاخه قبل از رشد اشاره دارد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta avser blomman, frukten eller skjutningen innan den utvecklas. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это относится к цветку, фрукту или побегу до его развития. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這是指花朵，果實或嫩芽發育之前。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Refere-se à flor, fruta ou broto antes que ela se desenvolva.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to sound emitted by an animal, but not speech.
Dies wird nur bei Tiergeräuschen verwendet, nicht bei Sprache.
این به صدای ساطع شده توسط حیوان اشاره دارد ، اما نه گفتار. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta avser ljud som avges av ett djur, men inte tal. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это относится к звуку, издаваемому животным, но не к речи. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這是指動物發出的聲音，而不是語音。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Refere-se ao som emitido por um animal, mas não à fala. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This can also mean "lesson" in the sense of "Let this be a lesson to you!"[2]
Это также может означать "урок" в контексте "Пусть это будет тебе уроком!"[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: приготовиться к, быть предупрежденным о чем-то
See also the suffixes {-rup:v} and {-beH:v} for indicating preparation or readiness.
Смотрите также суффиксы {-rup:v} и {-beH:v} для обозначения подготовки или готовности.

table.name: mem
table.column: See {qawmoH:v} for an example of how to use a verb like this one.
Siehe {qawmoH:v} für Beispiele, wie man dieses Verb verwenden kann.
Смотрите {qawmoH:v} для примера того, как использовать глагол, как этот.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a reference to a poem which has the line: "From ghoulies and ghosties / And long-leggedy beasties / And things that go bump in the night, / Good Lord, deliver us!"

table.name: mem
table.column: The example makes clear that this word refers to temperature, and not to perception, emotion, or character.
▶ {ghun 'Iw HIq, rap boqrat chej.} "The bokrat liver is as warm as the bloodwine."[1]
▶ {ghun 'Iw HIq, rap boqrat chej.} "Печень бократа такая же тёплая, как и кровавое вино."[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: check, promissory note, IOU note (for monetary transactions)
چک ، سفته ، یادداشت IOU (برای معاملات پولی) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
支票，本票，借條（用於貨幣交易） [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Klingons don't use this sort of thing very often any more.
Klingonen benutzen so etwas nicht mehr sehr oft. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
کلینگونها دیگر از این نوع چیزها استفاده نمی کنند. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Klingons använder inte den här typen av saker ofta längre. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Клингоны не очень часто используют подобные вещи. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Klingons不再經常使用這種東西。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Os klingons não usam esse tipo de coisa com muita frequência. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column:
There is an idiom {ghung; qagh rur@@ghung:v, qagh:n, rur:v}.
{ghungHa':v@@ghung:v, -Ha':v} would be something like "not hungry any more".[2]

Есть идиома {ghung; qagh rur@@ghung:v, qagh:n, rur:v}.
{ghungHa':v@@ghung:v, -Ha':v} would be something like "not hungry any more".[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: увеличивать, усиливать, возрастать, множить, нарасти, возвышать

The word {ghurmoH:v@@ghur:v, -moH:v} appears on {SkyBox 14:src} (see {nISwI' beH:n}).[2]
MO confirmed at {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2011:src} that {ghur:v:nolink} is intransitive.
▶ {jaghpu'ra' bopujmoHtaHvIS, ghur tuqmeyraj quv.} "Honor will rise in your houses as you bring your enemies to their knees."[3]
▶ {jaghpu'ra' bopujmoHtaHvIS, ghur tuqmeyraj quv.} "Честь возвышается в ваших домах, также как вы ставите врагов на колени."[3]

table.name: mem
table.column:
The object of this verb is the thing to be launched, usually torpedoes. If the object is not specified either explicitly or by context, it is assumed to be torpedoes. Besides torpedoes, this verb can be used for rockets, missiles, energy beams, or anything else which goes from one point to another. It is also used to describe the action of pulling back the elastic band of a slingshot, or the lowering of a spear to a horizontal position to attack (see {ghuS:v:2}). This verb never takes the suffix {-rup:v}. ({TKD 4.2.2:src})
See also the suffixes {-rup:v} and {-beH:v} for indicating preparation or readiness.
Even though the definition starts with "be", this is not a stative verb. The subject is a person getting ready to use a device to launch something, not the device itself.

table.name: mem
table.column: den Speer zum Angriff horizontal senken
sänka (spjut) till horisontellt läge inför attack
mais baixo (lança) para horizontal para atacar

This verb can be used to describe the readying of any kind of projectile weapon, such as pulling back the elastic band of a slingshot. On a starship, it's used almost exclusively to refer to torpedoes (see {ghuS:v:1}).[1, p.64]

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to predicting based on one's feelings or just a wild guess.
Wird verwendet für Vorhersagen aus dem Bauch heraus, oder durch Raten.
این به پیش بینی بر اساس احساسات شخص یا فقط یک حدس وحشی اشاره دارد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Detta avser förutsägelse baserat på ens känslor eller bara en vild gissning. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Это относится к прогнозированию на основе своих чувств или просто дикой догадки. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
這是指根據一個人的感覺進行預測或只是一個瘋狂的猜測。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Isso se refere à previsão com base nos sentimentos de alguém ou apenas em um palpite. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
The term "gut feeling" refers to one's intuition.

table.name: mem
table.column: She is the actress who plays {be'etor:n:name}.

table.name: mem
table.column: expletive، بسیار قوی تر از "darn آن" [AUTOTRANSLATED]
ругательное слово, гораздо сильнее, чем "черт возьми"
palavrão, muito mais forte do que "danado"

table.name: mem
table.column: You don't seem to understand our situation.
Sie verstehen anscheinend die Situation nicht.
به نظر نمی رسد که وضعیت ما را درک کنیم. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Du verkar inte förstå vår situation. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Похоже, что вы не понимаете нашу ситуацию
你似乎不了解我們的情況。
Você parece não entender nossa situação.

table.name: mem
table.column: Spoken by {qeylIS'e' lIjlaHbe'bogh vay':n:name} to {qotar:n:name} in the {paq'batlh:src}.
Сказано в диалоге между {qeylIS'e' lIjlaHbe'bogh vay':n:name} и {qotar:n:name} в {paq'batlh:src}.
